metadata.name: Rebug #270
metadata.description:
A debug view of the underlying particulate algorithm of Atoms' Gaze and Quantum Folly. Refined as a gift for collectors.

Enjoy watching the structures form. Once it's fully rendered you can download a full resolution image of 3508 x 4961 px by ***double clicking/tapping***. At this size the piece is printable at A3 size at 300 dpi. If you're interested in acquiring a signed print please contact @KRANKARTA.

Created on Chrome desktop 103.0 on 2022-08-06 in javascript and GLSL. Results on other browsers/devices may vary.

metadata.name: CPoSOP Composition #89
metadata.description:
This is the second in series of works where we pay homage to Ken Knowlton, scientist and computer graphic pioneer and artist who passed on June 16, 2022. Ken Knowlton developed the famous EXPLOR language, (Explicit 2-D Patterns, Local Operations, and Randomness) while at Bell Labs. He published a paper describing it in 1975 entitled: MINI-EXPLOR, A FORTRAN-Coded Version of the EXPLOR Language for Mini (and larger) Computers. (https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/988049.988052)

This work is a mark of progress. Christopher Scussel and I are working on modernizing MINI-EXPLOR. Chris is working on updating the engine from the original FORTRAN code of the 1970’s and its other limitations to usable JavaScript. In concert, I am analyzing and synthesizing the capabilities of the code and identifying an aesthetic. Together we continue to update EXPLOR and add new features.

CPoSOP Composition is an original derivative work of Contour Plot of Superimposed Octagonal Pyramids that was one of Knowlton’s original test examples. (Example 3)

The original EXPLOR picture frame was limited to a fixed array of 140 x 140 “characters.” Chris has rewritten the code to make the picture space variable. In this piece I increased the image space to a resolution 250 x 250  picture cells. Each picture cell is a 3x3 pixel block. 

The EXPLOR functions are designed to interact with the current contents of each cell in the picture array. Every EXPLOR function has a rules parameter. In this test I’ve added a background. Thus when I draw my modified CPoSOP widget over the background it interacts with the color contents of a background cell or, the color of the cell based on a previously drawn widget.

I’ve modified the original CPoSOP code and replaced constants with random variables. (made it a Spatial Force). I create a regular grid (Form of Spatial Organization) of a random size and draw the CPoSOP widget 85% of the time in one of the grid elements positions. The grid provides a structure to the image and the CPoSOP widget provides visual interest. The interaction of the widgets with the background and each other are amazing. 

In keeping true to an EXPLOR vibe we use 4 color palettes. We let the computer randomly pick from three predefined palettes: Black and white. Four colors randomly chosen from set of 8 “Bauhaus” colors. And, four truly random colors.

We continue to honor the passing of Ken Knowlton with this NFT series. Here is an opportunity to collect an example image from the famous program he authored now updated by Scussel and Kolomyjec. A true piece of Computer Graphic Art history with a modern twist.

Dr. Bill Generative Art OG @ drbillkolomyjec.com

metadata.name: Morphing Convictions #40
metadata.description:
Everyday we move on by relying on our convictions. Their immutability often helps us take decisions or take shelter but can sometimes clash with the unknown, the different and the new. They can then crack, crumble and mutate. To change your convictions means changing the kind of person you want to be. It means changing your self-identity. And that is not just hard, it is scary. And beautiful.

Morphing Convictions is a piece that exists through two kind of outputs : Posters and Scenes. Posters are focusing on the contemplation of details and movements of a morphing conviction while the Scenes are interactive little worlds where you can explore a conviction in it's environment.

Please open in live mode to enjoy a much better experience.

Controls :

Posters & Scenes
• Click anywhere to enable audio.
• Press M to toggle mute.
• Press F to toggle the fullscreen mode.
• Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

Scenes only
• Drag and scroll to rotate and zoom.
• Click on objects, some might react.

———————

Morphing Convictions by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Morixels Carpets #225
metadata.description:
➡️ Every family in the land of the Morixels needs a Carpet ⬅️
In the future, you will need these َaccessories also remember that cats in the land of Morixels do not like to sleep on the ground.

This is an NFT Benefit for Morixels owners

If you have a minimum of 3 NFTs from Morixels
We whitelist you for having a minimum of 1 Morixels Carpet
Just keep in mind that you have to mint your NFT for up to a week, otherwise you will miss the opportunity.

You don't have Morixels?

Don't worry you can buy from the primary or the secondary market 👇

https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/slug/morixels-mans

The number of Traits in this collection is 6 (117 layers) and it has the ability to make 3,415,500 NFTs.

To create balance, these NFTs are randomly minted, and this is a chance for everyone to get a rare version. So due to the low price of these NFTs, if the rare version did not belong to you, it is still possible for you to mint the new NFTs.
To Produce this collection, all the layers were designed pixel by pixel, which was time-consuming and difficult. And this greatly increases the value of this collection.


🟧🟦
🟧🟧


Twitter: @Morixels

Website: https://morixels.com/

Designed by: @morteza_yousefy
Made in 2022

metadata.name: The Living Book #1 #3
metadata.description:
I have been exploring the medium of print for years. Mixing etching, silk-screening, offset, photocopy, risography, drawing and painting to design and craft experimental art books.From the day digital, which had always fascinated me, took over my publishing practice, I always liked to create bridges between these two worlds.

The Living Books is part of this series of hybrid and experimental works where paper and digital resonate.

This issue #1 is made of 64 pages that will be minted by collectors. A book will eventually be printed and the pages will follow the mint order. Each page exists in a cover version (c) and a xerox version (x).

Controls :

• Click to dive into each frame.
• Press C to toggle cover mode.
• Press X to toggle xerox mode.
• Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

———————

The Living Book #1 by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Precarious #238
metadata.description:
Minimal sculptures precariously balanced

Features:
1 - Toggle Border
2 - Save 2048 X 2048
3 - Save 4096 X 4096
4 - Save 8192 X 8192

Query Parameters:
grain=false - turns off grain texture
resolution=2048 - sets resolution

How it was made: 
https://www.jeffweber.art/precarious

Credit:
Thanks to @Estienne_ca for the grainy texture algorithm

metadata.name: Time Intertwined #100
metadata.description:
by Daeinc
May 2022

An exploration into time and motion. Two linear timelines - structural and surficial - are intertwined. By weaving these timelines at different points in time, almost infinite variations can be made. The changing relationship between the two creates dynamic and unique compositions and challenges the visual perception.

## Guide:
- Please note that the animation responds to window aspect ratio. This is an intentional behavior as part of interactivity. It reproduces the same outcome at the same ratio. 
- To export image at specific size, use URL parameters as below.
- See browser console for more info.
- Tested on MacOS 12.3.1 with Chrome 101.0

## Keyboard Interaction:
- [0] for exhibit. it switches to a different mode every 3 loops.
- [s] to export PNG image. use URL params for dimensions.
- [spacebar] to play/pause animation
- [1 ~ 5] for different play modes
- [1]: all 
- [2]: surficial 
- [3]: constant 
- [4]: all-constant
- [5]: structural
- [h] to toggle hi-DPI mode. (for retina display)

## URL Parameters:
- add parameters separated by ampersand to the URL ex. https://.../?fxhash=...&mode=exhibit&w=800&st=5.3
- [mode]: play mode (exhibit, all, surficial, constant, all-constant, structural)
- [w]: width. (ex. w=1200)
- [h]: height. (ex. h=600)
- [st]: structural timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. st=4.31)
- [su]: surficial timecode. up to 2 decimals (ex. su=15.04)
- [co]: constant offset. up to 2 decimals (ex. co=7.4)
- [pr]: pixel ratio. set it to 2 (or press [h]) for hi-DPI screens.

## License
CC-BY-NC 4.0
Please refer to the included LICENSE.md for license information.
Libraries used: p5, canvas-sketch, canvas-sketch-util, keyframes, easing equations from easings.net
